title: VIDEO EXCLUSIVE: Charlize Theron reveals the dark side to her Mad Max killer queen
text:
VIDEO EXCLUSIVE: Charlize Theron reveals the dark side to her Mad Max killer queen VIDEO EXCLUSIVE: Charlize Theron reveals the dark side to her Mad Max killer queen CHARLIZE THERON's eyes light up in our exclusive interview as she talks about her devastating portrayal of Imperator Furiosa in George Miller's Mad Max: Fury Road with Tom Hardy. PUBLISHED: 19:30, Fri, Oct 9, 2015 | UPDATED: 19:31, Fri, Oct 9, 2015 GETTY Charlize Theron goes from red carpet stunner to Mad Max warrior 
Mad Max has often seemed to be all about the boys and their four-wheeled toys. 
Well, not any more. 
Charlize Theron exploded into the iconic film franchise in Fury Road and ripped out a new role for female characters front and centre of the action. Related articles VIDEO: Downton's Lily James is a ZOMBIE killer in new trailer with... 
In this exclusive video, the Hollywood beauty talks about the game-changing role of Imperator Furiosa and her desire to stand equal to any male protagonist. 
Her pleasure is clear as she remembers series creator George Miller telling: "I want to create a female character that can stand next to Max." 
WATCH OUR CHARLIZE THERON INTERVIEW NEXT 
Furiosa is the, ahem, driving force of the revved-up fourth Mad Max film. 
Her quest to save the beautiful sister wives (led by Rosie Huntington-Whiteley) 
of the evil Immortan Joe is at the heart of the high-octane blockbuster. 
But it was still a little wishy-washy as motivation for Theron. 
"The idea of saving these women didn't feel as interesting, " she says. SG Rosie Huntington-Whiteley leads the wives of Immortan Joe 
"They belong to a man who hurt her incredibly and she's just had enough and she's gonna take these women with her. 
"She's gonna take what matters to him the most. 
"It really is the ultimate story of revenge," Theron adds with a grin. 
Miller also loves the contrast between the softer and tougher sides of his heroine. SG Charlize Theron and director George Miller 
"I thought it would be interesting to find someone who in another time would be regarded as a great beauty but in this post apocalyptic world has become a hard-bitten warrior," the director says. 
"The paradox â€“ here is a very strong woman, statuesque more than just physically in her person and spirit and you recognise a vulnerability, its not just a mask. 
You could almost be forgiven for thinking that this is not a film about Mad Max, himself, at all. 
Not that leading man Tom Hardy, has much to worry about after his star continues to rise with an electrifying turn as both Kray twins in Legend.
